title: Champion pronunciation.
body:
Just curious about how people pronounce certain champion names.

For example:

I pronounce Taliyah as: **Tahh-lee-yahhh**. Not **Ta-leigh ah**

Nasus as: **Nas-zeus**, not **Ney-zeus**

 Camille as: **Cam-ill** not **Cam-eel**

and Shaco as: **Shay-ko**, not **Shack-o**

Im just wondering wether theres the American pronunciation and the Kiwi pronunciation (Toe-m**ayy**-toe, Toe-m**ahh**-toe etc.)
or wether I'm just that badly dyslexic and blatantly can't read sounds properly. 

Which do you think it is?
and how how do you guys pronounce those champs?

replies.body:
Ta-lee-ya (as per the champ designer!)

Na-suss

Cam-ill

Shay-ko because I'm Aussie

I also say Warwick as Warrick and Veigar as Vay-Gar for the same reasons!

I wonder if Taliyah's designer intended that her name was to be pronounced Ta-**lee**-ya, (like in the champion spotlight) full stop!
or wether Ta-**lee**-ya was just the way they pronounced it, and it can be said properly as 
**Tah**-lee-yah as well. Its an interesting thought :P and i don't know the answer xD

We say Camille the same way i think, and the aussie "Shay-ko" pronunciation spreads to NZ as well xD But i haven't heard 'Warrick' that much. 

Very interesting :P

In my case (Caps is where the emphasis is)

Shaco: SHAH-ko (or sometimes SHAY-ko)
Camille: KA-meal
Taliyah: TAH-lee-ah (somtimes slips into ya instead of ah)
Nasus: NASS-us [rhyming with bass - the fish, not the instrument]

Others mentioned:
Veigar: VAY-ger (pretty much sounds like vauger)
Warwick: WAR-wick

I usually pronounce Janna as YAH-nah, which is apparently strange!

EDIT: Adjusted Camille, because derp

Ahh ok, its interesting to see that even within Riot there are different pronunciations. 

I say Taliyah the same as you, (emphasising the Tahh instead of the Lee)
But I pronounce Veigar as V-eye-gar, which is abnormal I've been told xD

Very interesting ^^

I dont think Janna as Yah-nah is that strange, Scandinavian words and names often have Y sounds instead of J, and words like Johannas and Jergens. are fairly universally known with a Yah sound. :P
Its certainly a cool way of saying it tho ^^

Pretty much everyone I've played with in voice chat gets confused about who I mean until I clarify who I mean by saying it the standard way - and then comments that it's strange or weird.  Back before original release, I mained AP Janna for a fair while - and I still can't stop saying it how I assumed it was pronounced at the time. It's funny how these kinds of things get stuck in your head!

I can see how that might have been confusing for people xD

Yea thats true, if you start doing something one way, its so difficult to switch it around and do it another way. 
I know when Azir's attack speed was moved from his passive to his W, it looks me ages to max W second instead of E xD

I suppose saying it how you do, adds some character into the voice banter though ^^

YAH-nah is proper.
It is a Scandinavian name, and how it is originally pronounced.

Problem is Riot is an American company so according to more of your employers it's GEN-NAR.

Camille is also a French name, and if I recall properly double Ls are pronounced really weird in the language of the cheese eating surrender monkeys.

You're all weird. Nasus is pronounced Soo-Zan.

And in his final boss skin, Veigar says "Unimaginable is the power of Veigar!"  and "I, Veigar, will knock you all down!" and pronounces it Vay-Gar, so that's what I go with. Figure the dude knows how to say his own name :D

I just base it off words that i know

Taliyah like the name natalia, the spellings funky and it sounds out of place to me when people say it like  T'Liyah

Ca-meal like chameleon, its got an e at the end so the sound is elongated i think.

Shaco like taco

Nasus like molasses

I personally go between them, partially dependant on who I am talking to, but I believe that most are what people initially thought it sounded like and when introduced to the pronunciation via means of champion spotlights and such, they haven't altered it. It also depends on your cultural background as well as any other languages you may speak. However, even though I go between pronunciations, I still try to be correct and use the Riot given pronunciations, unless they're wrong (see note: Xin Zhao) often with names inspired by other languages.
Personally I say: Ta-leigh ah, Nas-zeus, Cam-eel & Shack-o (mostly)

ahhh ok, i try to change Nas-zeus to Nay-zeus some of the time, but generally say something halfway between the two and get my tongue tied up xD

Its interesting that you view the riot pronunciation as 'correct' (as in, thats the one true way to say it) you don't just think its just the difference between Tomato (toe-may-toe) instead of Tomato (toe-mah-toe)? where both are correct, but some people say it one way and some say it the other. 

Im not sure which one i think it is actually. xD

I did say that I generally use the Riot pronunciation, however there are many cases when they are wrong often with names based off of other languages. But considering that they are the creators of this work, I am more likely to base my own pronunciation off of theirs.

Out of those. I pronounce Taliyah the same as you, the other way is just stupid in my opinion. Nasus I say as Nah-Sis. Shaco I say as Shake-O. And Camille as Ca-Meal.

Looking at others...

Mayo-Ky
Warwick as War-Rick (the name)
Vee-Gar
Ay-Trox
Jan-Nah

I don't usually mind what people call the champs, it is usually just what they are supposed to be pronounced as that is so dumb. Like Taleah.

Those ones for me are:
Tah-lee-yah
Nas-seus
Ka-meal
Shay-ko

A few others I don't know the correct pronunciation of that seem a bit strange to me:
Aatrox = A-trox
Gragas = Grah-gas
Maokai = Mau-Ky (I *think* that one is correct?)
Mordekaiser = Mord-eh-ky-zer (Also *think* this is correct?)
Sejuani = Sej-wan-ee
Veigar = Vay-gar
Vi = Vy
Xerath = Zeer-rath
Yorick = Your-rick

I say.
Ta-leigh ah
Nas-zeus
Cam-ill
Shack-o
